1.title: 13th Amendment
1.subtitle: The 13th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution, ratified in 1865 in the aftermath of the Civil War, abolished slavery in the United States.

1.title: Support the Equal Justice Initiative
1.subtitle: Your contribution is critical to efforts to end mass incarceration and excessive punishment in the United States, challenge racial and economic injustice, and protect the basic human rights for the most vulnerable people in American society.

1.title: American Civil Liberties Union
1.subtitle: Donate to the ACLU. The ACLU has been at the center of nearly every major civil liberties battle in the U.S. for over 100 years. This vital work depends on the support of ACLU members in all 50 states and beyond.

2.title: Dr. Ernest Everett Just
2.subtitle: Dr. Ernest Just was a pioneering African American biologist, academic and science writer. Just's primary legacy is his recognition of the fundamental role of the cell surface in the development of organisms.

2.title: Spoon & Theory Handmade
2.subtitle: Spoon and Theory handmade is a black-owned creative arts, jewelry and aromatherapy goods store. We provide goods from upcycled leather to Eco-inspired laser cut jewelry + aromatherapy diffuser jewelry + aromatherapy body + home goods.

products.name: Jubilee Ankara Face Mask with Nose Bridge
products.description: Secure, then fasten the double strings around the base of head for comfortable yet snug fit, eliminating irritation behind ears. Minneapolis mask makers, quality face masks.

products.name: Nove Abstract Color Block Wood Earrings
products.description: Royal Purple, turquoise, with antique bronze. Handmade in the Midwest and ready-to-ship in 3-5 days.

products.name: Oatmeal and Spice Moisturizing Body Bar
products.description: This soap is great for those with suffer from dry skin. With warm hints of cinnamon and clove, the mild creamy exfoliating lather leaves skin feel smooth, soft and smelling delicious.

3.title: QuintesScential Candles
3.subtitle: Since we love burning scented candles, we decided to embark on our journey of becoming Black chandlers. We decided, from the beginning, to use only the healthiest ingredients in anything that we make and sell.

products.name: Earthy
products.description: Earthy is a sensual fragrance that lives up to its name. Our Earthy is aromatic, woodsy, and intoxicating, with a prominent sandalwood base, complemented by layers of sage, spice, and amber.

products.name: Sweet Dreams
products.description: Ready for bed? Time to unwind from a hectic day? Escape with gentle notes of lavender on your pillow with the crisp scent of freshly washed linen.

products.name: Pleasantry
products.description: Our Pleasantry is a proven pleaser, combining a patented odor neutralizing technology with a crisp, clean fragrance that brings to mind fresh linens drying on the line. Pleasantry doesn't just cover up unwanted smells, it cancels them out.

3.title: Negro League Baseball
3.subtitle: Negro League Baseball got its start thanks to the increasing popularity of two things after the Civil War: baseball and segregation.

4.title: What If I Don't Move to the Back of the Bus?
4.subtitle: Rosa Parks brought together a unique blend of life experiences, a commitment to racial justice, and a flawless reputation to transform a single act of defiance into a defining moment for the modern American civil rights movement.

4.title: Not all Black people are African American. Here's the difference.
4.subtitle: Black Lives Matter protests have opened up conversations about the history of privilege, racism, and the lived experiences and identities of black people in America. Now, the distinction between "Black" and "African American" has become a prominent conversation on social media.

5.title: Brown v. Board: Timeline of School Integration in the U.S.
5.subtitle: Trace school integration from 1849 to 2007.

5.title: The Case for Reparations
5.subtitle: Two hundred fifty years of slavery. Ninety years of Jim Crow. Sixty years of separate but equal. Thirty-five years of racist housing policy. Until we reckon with our compounding moral debts, America will never be whole.

6.title: Robert Tanner Freeman - Bytes of History
6.subtitle: Robert Tanner Freeman was born in Washington DC in 1846. He was the son of slaves who had bought their freedom in the 19th century. Historical records are unclear but they probably adopted the surname Freeman in response to their transition.

6.title: Black on Black
6.subtitle: Black On Black™ is beautifully designed clothing & accessories that are both clothing line AND protest sign. Black On Black™ is a social protest on clothing that De:Constructs the Construct.

products.name: "Anti-Racist Social Club" Throw Pillows
products.description: These cozy throw pillows feature high-quality fabric and prints that will upgrade your space. Zippered cover care instructions: machine wash in cold water using mild detergent and gentle cycle only, hang to dry.

products.name: "Juneteenth" - Unisex T
products.description: Juneteenth is the oldest known celebration commemorating the ending of slavery in the United States.  Dating back to 1865, it was on June 19th that the Union soldiers, led by Major General Gordon Granger, landed at Galveston, Texas with news that the war had ended and that the enslaved were now free.

products.name: "Energy I Be On AKA Black Powered" - Unisex Long-Sleeved T
products.description: "Black Powered" T-Shirt - When I think about the greatness of us and all that we've been able to become DESPITE all that we've been through and STILL going through, one reason that is specific to us is, US.

7.title: Harrison Blake Apparel
7.subtitle: Harrison Blake Apparel has found a way to deliver high quality men's accessories at a great price. The style and variety of products are sure to please any gentleman.

products.name: Berry Dot Necktie
products.description: A great microfiber necktie - in a beautiful design and color scheme = priceless! Grab yours now. Get compliments later...

products.name: Black Tooth Bow Tie
products.description: A self-tied bow tie is a classic accessory that everyone needs in their wardrobe. Handmade quality is what you'll find in all our neckwear offerings.

products.name: Gold Circle and Star Earrings
products.description: Unique, Elegant and Simple design. Add a nice touch to complete your look for any occasion. All of our jewelry is silver or gold plated and hypoallergenic.

7.title: Carter G. Woodson - African American Trailblazers in Virginia History
7.subtitle: Enjoy a six-minute podcast on the life of Carter G. Woodson who helped start the first Negro History Week.

8.title: Oprah Winfrey's Cecil B. DeMille Award Acceptance Speech - 2018 Golden Globe Awards
8.subtitle: Watch Oprah Winfrey's 2018 Golden Globe Awards acceptance speech for the Cecil B. DeMille Award.

8.title: Demand Justice for Casey Christian Goodson Jr
8.subtitle: On Friday, December 4th, 23 year-old Casey Christian Goodson Jr, was shot three times in the back and murdered by police. They mistook his subway sandwich for a gun. Sign this petition to demand justice.

9.title: Black Lives Matter
9.subtitle: We appreciate your support of the movement and our ongoing fight to end state-sanctioned violence, liberate Black people, and end white supremacy forever.

9.title: CarmaBella Skincare
9.subtitle: CarmaBella Skincare is made for women who want the best skincare, without any artificial chemicals or unnecessary ingredients. When using our products, you don't have to choose between natural and luxurious.

products.name: Brightening Turmeric Clay Mask
products.description: Want an instant glow? We have the perfect natural skincare product to help you achieve it. The Brightening Turmeric Clay Mask instantly brightens dull, tired skin and restores your skins healthy complexion over time.

products.name: HydroSurge Moisturizing Gel
products.description: The HydroSurge Moisturizing Gel replenishes water and helps to improve your skin's moisture barrier, resulting in smooth, hydrated skin. This addictively refreshing gel leaves skin plump, dewy, and glowing.

products.name: The Essential Bath & Body Set
products.description: The Essential Bath & Body Set is a nourishing collection that will leave your skin feeling soft and moisturized all day. This set includes the Natural Sugar Based Body Wash, a bath puff, and the Nourishing Shea Body Lotion.

9.title: Here Are the 18 African-American Astronauts
9.subtitle: It was 22 years after Alan Shepard’s first space trip that the U.S. sent a person of color up.

10.title: Netflix Explained: Racial Wealth Gap
10.subtitle: Cory Booker and others discuss how slavery, housing discrimination and centuries of inequality have compounded to create a racial wealth gap.

10.title: Civil Rights Act - Britannica
10.subtitle: Civil Rights Act, (1964), comprehensive U.S. legislation intended to end discrimination based on race, colour, religion, or national origin.

11.title: Remembering South African leader Nelson Mandela
11.subtitle: Nelson Mandela, the first black president of South Africa credited with ending apartheid there, died in Johannesburg on Dec. 5, 2013. Former PBS NewsHour correspondent Charlayne Hunter-Gault takes a look back at Mandela's life and legacy.

11.title: Know Your Rights Camp
11.subtitle: Colin Kaepernick's organization's mission is to advance the liberation and well-being of Black and Brown communities through education, self-empowerment, mass-mobilization and the creation of new systems that elevate the next generation of change leaders.

12.title: Nation's Premier Civil Rights Organization
12.subtitle: Founded February 12, 1909, the NAACP is the nation’s foremost, largest, and most widely recognized civil rights organization. Its more than half-million members and supporters throughout the United States and the world are the premier advocates for civil rights in their communities, leading grassroots campaigns for equal opportunity and conducting voter mobilization.

12.title: Open a random campaign to donate to
12.subtitle: Take the effort of decision out of it -- tap here and we'll select a random campaign for you to support!
12.info: Update to the latest version of the app to get access to this feature

13.title: The Costs of Racism to White People
13.subtitle: We tend to think of racism as a problem for people of color and something we should be concerned about for their sake. However, the costs of racism to white people are devastating, especially to those of us without the money and power to buffer their effects.

13.title: When the first all-black professional basketball team dominated...back in the ’20s
13.subtitle: "They were literally pioneers and recognized that they were making a statement in front of the audiences."

14.title: Frederick Douglass
14.subtitle: Frederick Douglass was an escaped slave who became a prominent activist, author and public speaker.

14.title: Text a bot for book suggestions
14.subtitle: Twitter user @ecmoy created a bot that you can text for recommendations of books written by Black authors based on genre. It will also link you to a Black-owned bookstore that is selling the title. Text (409) 404-0403 to try it!

15.title: Riot Swim
15.subtitle: Riot Swim is an online designer swimwear and beachwear brand, offering an exclusive collection of bikinis, one piece swimsuits, and more.

products.name: Echo One Piece- Kiwi
products.description: Minimal coverage front and back. Doubles as bodysuit. Body sculpting. Fitted at waist to flatter curves.

products.name: Pico Top-Chocolate
products.description: Full coverage top. Adjustable tie. Body sculpting. No Padding.

products.name: Riot Crop Tee-Black
products.description: Short-sleeve crop. Cotton tee. Round neck.

15.title: Remembering Henry Lewis, first Black conductor of a major symphony orchestra
15.subtitle: Henry Lewis’ love and passion for music and symphony was indescribable.

16.title: Bessie Smith, The Empress of the Blues
16.subtitle: She was big and brown and built high off the ground — "a hell of a woman," men called her, but most women said she was "rough." And while there were other blues singers in the first half of the 20th century — some who shared her surname — none could be mistaken for Bessie Smith.

16.title: Justice For Tony McDade
16.subtitle: Tony McDade was a transgender black man who got killed by police in Tallahassee. Sign this petition and encourage others to do so as well to get his name out there.

17.title: Legends profile: Michael Jordan
17.subtitle: By acclamation, Michael Jordan is the greatest basketball player of all time. Although, a summary of his basketball career and influence on the game inevitably fails to do it justice, as a phenomenal athlete with a unique combination of fundamental soundness, grace, speed, power, artistry, improvisational ability and an unquenchable competitive desire, Jordan single-handedly redefined the NBA superstar.

17.title: Shop Thoughtful
17.subtitle: thoughtful is a nonprofit that seeks to promote black businesses and create a one-stop-shop for consumers who want to vote with their wallets. thoughtful does not take any commissions off of the businesses it promotes, it is purely a hub designed to uplift and support established Black-owned businesses online.

18.title: Support the King Center
18.subtitle: The King Center remain committed to proactively educating and training individuals and leaders across all sectors in Nonviolence365 to influence equitable change in our national and global infrastructure.

18.title: The Words of Martin Luther King Jr. Reverberate in a Tumultuous Time
18.subtitle: Dr. King’s speeches have particular resonance today amid a year of sickness and death, Black Lives Matter protests and the storming of the Capitol.

19.title: Toni Morrison - Biography
19.subtitle: Toni Morrison was a Nobel and Pulitzer Prize-winning American novelist. Among her best-known novels are "The Bluest Eye," "Song of Solomon," "Beloved," and "A Mercy."

19.title: Official Black Wall Street
19.subtitle: Get thousands of Black-owned businesses at your fingertips with the largest online platform for Black businesses.

20.title: Amanda Gorman Inauguration Poem
20.subtitle: Watch and read the youngest poet laureate, Amanda Gorman, recite her poem "The Hill We Climb"

20.title: Post 21
20.subtitle: Post 21 was created by a Mother-Daughter duo who wanted a comprehensive marketplace that focused on products from Black-owned businesses. They felt strongly that there’s no reason why these products are consistently being discovered when they should be household names. So, they said let’s create the place we want to shop.

20.title: John Hope - Biography
20.subtitle: John Hope was an important African American educator and race leader of the early twentieth century. In 1906 he became the first Black president of Morehouse College—the alma mater of Martin Luther King Jr.—in Atlanta.

21.title: Microaggressions Matter
21.subtitle: They may not always be ill-intentioned, but the slights illuminate deeper problems in America.

21.title: The Legacy of Malcom X
21.subtitle: This podcast series about Malcom X El-Hajj Malik El-Shabazz brings together scholars from a variety of fields and is an invitation to connect our ideas, research projects, and activism across disciplinary divides.

22.title: How to be an Antiracist
22.subtitle: This conversation with professor Ibram X. Kendi was recorded during the 2019 Aspen Ideas Festival in Aspen, Colorado. In it, he explores what an antiracist society might look like, how we can play an active role in building it, and what being an antiracist in your own context might mean.

22.title: Donating Tip
22.subtitle: Maximize your impact by making smaller, monthly donations to a few different organizations.
22.info: Don't just let your donations be a one-time lump sum donation. Instead, spread the love out with smaller, recurring, monthly donations to continue supporting the movement beyond your first donation.

22.title: African-American Heroism in the Military
22.subtitle: Dating all the way back to the American Revolution, African-Americans have played key roles in the history (and success) of the U.S. military. Profiled below are some notable African-Americans and their achievements, as well as milestones in the integration of African-Americans in the U.S. military.

23.title: What Anti-racist Teachers Do Differently
23.subtitle: They view the success of black students as central to the success of their own teaching. Read more from Pirette McKamey, principal of San Francisco’s Mission High School and an anti-racist educator for more than 30 years.

23.title: The Collective PAC
23.subtitle: The Collective is strengthening our democracy by addressing the significant underrepresentation of the Black community in public office. We are fighting for equal representation and protection under the law so it is vital that we have Black candidates run, and Black voices heard.

23.title: Constance Baker Motley: Judiciary’s Unsung Rights Hero
23.subtitle: Constance Baker Motley was an unlikely civil rights hero. An African American who grew up near Yale University, she did not personally experience overt racism until late in high school, and as a young person she was almost totally unaware of black history.

24.title: Sugarfoots
24.subtitle: Sugarfoots anchor product is a renowned child-safe, hand-crafted multi-ethnic rag doll, complemented by a children’s book series based on folktales from cultures around the world. Our mission is sustained by a performing arts summer camp for youth that sets the pace among competitors, inspiriting the imagination through creative storytelling, song and dance.

24.subtitle: These trailblazers broke barriers and shattered stereotypes — and went on to conduct research, discover treatments, and provide leadership that improved the health of millions.

There’s a multi-purpose clip designed for strollers or diaper bags so it can travel with you. Exploring role play fun at home and on the go. Yummy Buddy has crinkly ears, both chewable "glow" silicone hands, teething bib, multiple colors, and chimes when shaken, too! The perfect sensory chew toy.

25.title: Hiram Rhodes Revels - Biography
25.subtitle: A freeman his entire life, Hiram Rhodes Revels was the first African American to serve in the U.S. Congress. With his moderate political orientation and oratorical skills honed from years as a preacher, Revels filled a vacant seat in the United States Senate in 1870.

26.subtitle: The 15th Amendment granting African-American men the right to vote was adopted into the U.S. Constitution in 1870.

27.title: 11 Black Athletes Who Made Winter Olympic History
27.subtitle: Black Olympic athletes come from a long line of pioneers who made it possible for them to compete and win at the Olympics. And even though the Olympic Games have been around for centuries, there are still Black athletes who become the first to compete in their sport at the Olympics.

28.subtitle: Ever wonder what driving would be like without turn signals or traffic lights? In celebration of Black History Month, we want to share a few of their exciting stories with you.

products.description: Our most compact wireless earbuds for your everyday grind. Designed to deliver more powerful sound than any earbuds of its size.

products.description: Choose what you hear with superior noise cancellation that enhances sound quality while blocking outside distractions. Push the boundaries and find your flow with fully immersive surround sound.

products.name: The Runner's Belt
products.description: A nifty and lightweight belt to fuel your workouts. Hold your smartphone, Raycon earbuds, and other daily essentials for your run or gym sessions.

30.title: RayTec Audio
30.subtitle: RayTec, wherever you go, your soundtrack should follow. Music has changed the world. It's a form of expression and should be heard at the highest, premium level. When you hear music that you like, when you're listening to a book of your choosing, you get excited, or motivated or you may become active.

products.name: RayTec Airpods
products.description: Ideal for hands free activities: Exercising, phone calls, music, working, audio books, and tuning the world out!

products.name: RayTec Watch6 — Black Case

products.name: RayTec-C10 Headphones
products.description: Comfy on the ears, Adjustable to fit on your head, Foldable, Chargeable, Super bass

31.title: Know Your Rights Camp
31.subtitle: Colin Kaepernick's organization's mission is to advance the liberation and well-being of Black and Brown communities through education, self-empowerment, mass-mobilization and the creation of new systems that elevate the next generation of change leaders.

31.title: Justice for Lakeith Smith
31.subtitle: Lakeith Smith, now 20, was charged with the murder of his friend, A’Donte Washington when he was only 15— a crime he did not commit. A'donte died at the hands of a policeman, after the police fired 4 rounds into him - and he currently walks free.
